there there are over a hundred fires

there's a real concern about what the

Australian life but everyone here has
been shocked by the ferocity of this
year's season architect Nick Turner
spent years designing and building a
beautiful garden and home in the
Kangaroo Valley he knew that this day
would one day come he sheltered with
eight of his neighbours in his home and
watched a cyclonic fire storm head
towards his house this is the story of
how he and his neighbors survived and
his home we save the house and the house
saved us and that was a nexus that if it
had broken at any point would have meant
that we would have perished there was
like if you're you know a very big

the horizontal rain was horizontal
burning pieces of wood flying through

this was what was happening here last

that's the most distressing thing I

50 odd cows he's got three left
well this bushfire crisis has put huge
attention on Australia's fossil fuel

crisis is so severe in part because
Australia has been getting hotter across
